item.title: Coding probelm *no debuging needed*
item.dc:creator: @jr_pwn jr pwn
item.description:
@jr_pwn wrote:

ok i solved that problem all i need was the

if(IsMining = false && (actionTimer == 0 && (playerLevel[14] >= 30 && (HasItemAmount(1275, 1)))))

to be changed to

if(IsMining == false && (actionTimer <= 0 && (playerLevel[14] >= 30 && (HasItemAmount(1275, 1)))))

but now it makes me click the rock again after 15 seconds to get the ore and the xp how do i make it auto do that?

Read full topic

item.title: Coding probelm *no debuging needed*
item.dc:creator: @jr_pwn jr pwn
item.description:
@jr_pwn wrote:

OK im trying to code my own mining here is what i have for my first coal rock.

case 2096: case 2097: if(IsMining = false && (actionTimer == 0 && (playerLevel[14] >= 30 && (HasItemAmount(1275, 1))))) { IsMining = true; actionTimer = 15; setAnimation(0x554); sendMessage("you begin to mine ore....."); } else if(IsMining = true && (actionTimer <= 0)) { addItem(453, 1); addSkillXP((10*playerLevel[14]), 14); resetAnimation(); IsMining = false; } else { sendMessage("You do not have the level required to mine this ore"); } break;

ok the problem is this. It’s supposed to wait 15 whatever the time measeurment is then give you a coal rock give you xp and reset your animation so you stop mining. It automatically gives me the coal and the xp but i never wait or do the animation. I also know that you dont have to have a rune pickaxe aka 1275 to start mining. If you reply and say well 15 seconds is to quick its just going threw it to quick. It never sends me messages either and ive changed the 15 to 55 and 500 and it still does the same thing.

Read full topic
